greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximal coefficient (in absolute value) of cyclotomic polynomial C(N,x), where N = n-th number which is a product of exactly three distinct primes = A007304(n).
comment: E. Lehmer (1936) shows that this sequence is unbounded.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Emma Lehmer, On the magnitude of the coefficients of the cyclotomic polynomial, Bull. Amer. Math. Soc. 42 (1936), 389-392.
maple: b:= proc(n) option remember; local k;
bigomega(k)<>3 or nops(factorset(k))<>3 do od; k
mathematica: f[n_] := Max[ Abs[ CoefficientList[ Cyclotomic[n, x], x]]]; t = Take[ Sort@ Flatten@ Table[Prime@i Prime@j Prime@k, {i, 3, 35}, {j, 2, i -1}, {k, j -1}], 105]; f@# & /@ t (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 09 2016 *)
xref: See A278571 for smallest m such that a(m) = n.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 26 2016
